text:
Hey guys it’s Ro! Welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

I got so many requests from you guys to make
something else Minions related!

I’m super excited because The Minion Movie
just came out on DVD and my

whole family loves this movie. I think I’m
gonna get it for my Mom for Christmas.
So like, shhh, don’t tell her!

So today we are gonna be making Banana Cake
Pops that look like the little Minions,
because we all know that Minions love banan-ers!

And, at the end of the video, I’m gonna
have some special guests on, so stay tuned!
And now, let’s get started!

The banana cake that we’re gonna be making
today is gonna be made from scratch.

So first, I’m gonna show you all the different
ingredients that we’ll need,

and then later, I’ll show you all of the
different things you’ll need to decorate.

So the things you’ll need to make this yummy
banana cake, will be:

1 tub of vanilla frosting, this is about 16
ounces if you find it in the store.

2-1/2 cups of flour, 1 cup of sugar, 2/3 cup
of buttermilk, 1/2 a cup of butter,

1 tablespoon of baking soda, pinch of salt,
2 eggs, 3/4 cup brown sugar,
and 4 ripe banan-ers!

Some baking spray, a mixing bowl, a potato
masher, and a baking pan, this one is

9x13 and I’ve lined it with a piece of parchment
paper at the bottom.
Alright, now let’s put it all together!

The first thing that we’re gonna do is mash
our banan-ers!

The big question, do you peel your banana
from the bottom or the top?
I’ve always…
I’ve always peeled it from… The top!

Alright, so you’re gonna peel all of the
bananas, toss ‘em in the bowl.

And then you’re gonna take your potato masher,
and mash ‘em up!
Ma-mash ‘em up! Ma-mash ‘em up!
Bananas! Bananas! Bananas!

Alright, now we’ve got our mashed banana
mush, and I’m just gonna set this off

to the side. And now we’re gonna mix together
our dry ingredients into another bowl
that I have right here.

So you’re gonna take your flour, pinch of
salt, baking soda, our sugar, and brown sugar!

Once you’ve got all of your dry ingredients
in the bowl we’re gonna whisk ‘em
together until they’re evenly combined.
Now, we are back to the banana mix.
So we meet again banan-er!

And we’re gonna be adding our butter. I’ve
heated it up in the microwave,

so it’s melted, you’ll just want to pour
it in. Ooooh!

Then we’re gonna pour in our buttermilk,
and our 2 eggs!

Then you’re gonna take a hand mixer and
mix together until it’s evenly combined!

Now we’ve got the wet banana mixture over
here, it kinda looks like pancake mix.

And it smells so good! It smells like a fresh
banana pancake!
And then over here we’ve got our dry mix.

And now we are gonna combine the dry mix into
the wet banana mix.

I like to do it in halves. So we’re gonna
pour 1/2, doo-doo-doo-doo! Into the bowl.

And mix it up, and then when it’s combined,
then add the other 1/2.

Ooooh! Look at that, we now have our banana
cake batter, it’s all ready, and it

smells so good! If you guys like banana bread,
you may love this recipe!
It is so yummy, I love baking with fresh fruit!
Yum-yum-yum-yum-yum-yum-yum! Banan-ers!

Grease the pan first, we really don’t want
the cake to stick to any of the edges.

Then you’re gonna take a piece of parchment
paper, I’ve cut it to be the size
of the bottom of the pan, and, one more spray.

Now we’re gonna pour in our cake batter,
weee-oooo!

Our cake is ready to go, we’re gonna
bake the cake at 350 degrees for about 30 minutes.

Just keep your eye on it, as soon as you can
insert a little toothpick into the

center, and pull it out and have none of the
crumbs stick to it, it’s ready!
Here, guys, guys let me clear off the counter!

We got little crumbs, let me just dust it
off!
Doop-doop-doop-doop!

Once our cake has baked and had plenty of
time to cool, we are going to crumb it

into a big mixing bowl and add our frosting
to make our cake pop mixture.

It’s really easy, what I like to do is take
a sharp cutting knife, and
just cut into sections, doo-doo-doo.

So I like to cut it in half, right down the
middle, then we’re just gonna pick up

a few sections, and then you can rub ‘em
together, doo-doo-doo-doo-doo!
To make little crumbs in the bowl.

And then you’re gonna do this to all of
the pieces.
I have got the cake all crumbed, now we’re gonna add our frosting.

I just scoop it in with a little spatula,
just put the whole thing in there.

And, if you like your cake pops less sweet,
you can use cream cheese instead of frosting.

But today, I’m gonna be using frosting because
this cake is like banana bread,

it’s not as sweet as other vanilla cakes,
so it needs a little bit of sugar in here!

Just finished mixing in all the frosting and
now we are going to roll them into

our little minions. Over here I’ve got a
cookie sheet, lined with a piece of
wax paper, so that they won’t stick.

And you’re just gonna take a little bit,
like this, doo-doo-doo-doo-doo!

Usually when I’m making cake pops I just
roll 'em into a round ball, but this time

I’m gonna be making it a little bit oval
shaped, to look like Kevin.

Because Kevin’s kind of the tall Minion,
so I’m gonna make a few that are tall, then

I’m gonna make a few that are medium height
for Stuart. And then I’m gonna make
a few that are more circular and smaller that look like Bob!

Oh! Look at him! He’s little, just like
Bob and me!

Once you’ve filled the tray we’re gonna
pop these in the refrigerator for about

30 minutes,  remember, you want them chilled,
but not frozen.

And, I’m gonna work on a second tray, because
I got a lot left over!
Yum-yum-yum-yum-yum!

While the minion pops are chilling we’re
gonna gather all the things that we’ll need

to decorate. We’ve got, blue candy melts,
yellow candy melts, black sprinkles,

black M&M’s, Smarties candy, we’re gonna
be using the white ones in these little sticks.

Black decorator icing, lollipop sticks and
some edible food writer pens.

The first thing that we’re gonna do is we're gonna heat
up our blue candy melts.

I heated up our blue candy melts in this little
fondue pot over here, and ooh!
Look at that, it is ready!

But, if you don’t have one of these pots,
don’t worry, you can just heat them up in
the microwave, no worries!

And, over here, our little cake pops have
had plenty of time to chill.

So now, we’re gonna take the little lollipop
sticks, we’re gonna dip into

the candy melts, just a little bit, it’s
gonna act as an adhesive.

And then we’re gonna place them at the end
of our cake pops.

And then we’re gonna press them about 1/2
way in.

All of our cake pops are assembled with lollipop
sticks, and now I’m gonna pop these

in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes to
set.

The cake pops have set in the fridge and now
we are gonna dip them.

I’m just gonna take one of these, and I’m
gonna completely submerge it into the

blue melts. You’re just gonna dip straight
down like this, let it touch the end of

the lollipop stick, and then pull straight
up.

We’re gonna let the excess drip off, by
going tap-tap-tap-tap-tap.

And to get a very smooth finish, I’m gonna
dip it one more time.

Then we’re gonna stick it over here into
a piece of foam, and let it dry.

And we’re gonna do this to the rest of our
cake pops.

Once the cake pops have set, now we’re gonna
dip them into yellow, to look like
the little Minion’s faces!

And you’re gonna dip it, doo-doo-doo-doo-doo!
About 2/3 of the way down.

And if it looks a little bit green, you can
dip it again, do a second dip.
And place it back over into the foam to dry.

Our cake pops are all dipped to look like
little minions. And now we’re gonna

add little black sprinkles, to look like their
hair.

Bob is bald, Bob doesn’t have any hair,
so the small little pops we’re gonna leave

without any hair. And then the taller pops,
the longest pops, that’s Kevin, and

he has hair right in the middle, so we’re
gonna put a bunch of sprinkles right

in the middle. The medium pops are little
Stuarts, so we’re gonna have their hair,

the little sprinkles lay flat, parting down
the middle.

I’m gonna take some baking tweezers, pick
up a little sprinkle, like this,

dip it into the candy melts, and stick it
right on top of the pop!

And you’re just gonna place a whole bunch
of ‘em down to look like parted hair.

Our little minion pops are starting to come
together, they’ve got little hair,

they’ve got their little denim overalls
on the bottom, and now I’ve just scooped

a little bit of blue candy melt into a plastic
bag with a number 2 tip.

And I’m just gonna draw a dividing line
between the Minion’s skin and his denim.

Now we’re gonna attach the little feet,
I’m gonna take the black M&Ms, and on

the side that has the “M,” That’s the
side you’re going to dip into the candy melt.

And then you place it at the end of the pop,
right there.
Oh my gosh he’s adorable, look at that!

And hold it for about 10 seconds, for the
candy melt to set.
1 banan-er, 2 banan-er, 3 banan-er, 4!
5 banan-er, 6 banan-er, 7 banan-er, more!

Now you’re gonna do this to the rest of
your cake pops.

Now we are gonna decorate our eyes and then
we are gonna stick them onto our minions.

So over here, I have sorted the Smarties,
and I’ve got all the white Smarties,

and then I have 3 edible food writer markers,
I have brown, black and green.

And I’m first gonna decorate a few eyeballs
to be Stuart’s eyeballs, Stuart

only has one eyeball and he has one big brown
eye.

We’re gonna color the iris brown, then with
a black pen I’m gonna add a little
bit of detail, I’m gonna put a little pupil.

Now I’m gonna make some for Bob, so Bob
has one green eye, and then one brown eye,

so I’m gonna color some of them brown, some
of them green.
And then for Kevin, he has 2 brown eyes.

Got all of our little eyes decorated and now
it’s time to stick ‘em on our little

minion pops. Over here I’ve got some black
decorating icing.

And I’ve put a number 3 tip at the end for
a little bit more control.

Just gonna place a little bit of decorator
icing on the back, it’s gonna act

as an adhesive, and I’m just gonna put it
right in the middle.

Because this one is Stuart. And then this
is the fun part, to make it look like

a goggle, I am gonna ice a little black decorator
icing all the way around,
and draw the straps of the goggle, going around.

Last, final step is I drew a little smile
onto our minion, I switched the tip
to a number 2, so it’d be a finer point.

And, da-dew! There you go, there’s our little
Stuart, and now you can make as
many minions as you’d like.

Ta-da! Here are the Minion Cake Pops that
we made today!

Using a yummy, from scratch, banana cake recipe!
I hope you guys love ‘em, these

are so good! I’m gonna be posting lots of
pictures on Facebook, Tumblr,

Instagram and Twitter, and if you guys make
these, please take a picture and
send it to me, I love seeing your baking creations!
I get a big kick out of it, it makes my day!

This is the perfect little treat to snack
on while you’re watching the new

Minions movie. It comes out on DVD and Blue-Ray
today, I am so excited!
We’ve got Stuart, Kevin, and Bob!

I love Bob, he’s my favorite! Let me know
in the comments below what your

favorite Minion is, and if you have any other
ideas for any other Nerdy Nummies,

please let me know, leave me a comment down
below and I will do my best to make
it happen!

And as promised, here are my special guests,
my knights in shining denim!

Oh my gosh! You guys, I made pops to look
like little Minions!

Bob, this one’s you, Kevin this one’s
you, and Stuart, this one’s you.

A big thank you to Universal Studios for teaming
up with me to make this

video possible, and for sending my friends
over!
My Minion friends!
Thanks again you guys, bye-bye!
High-five! High-three!
